abstract.text: The

is a convenience class that handles advertising, presents incoming invitations to the user, and handles users’ responses. Use this class to provide a user interface for handling invitations when your app does not require programmatic control over the invitation process.

inlineContent.text: Before you can advertise a service, you must create an
object that identifies your app and the user to nearby devices.

abstract.text: Dismisses a presented view controller, using the same animator that presented it.
Presents another view controller as a sheet.
Dismisses the view controller that was presented modally by the view controller.
Initiates the segue with the specified identifier from the current view controller’s storyboard file.
Notifies the view controller that a segue is about to be performed.
Presents a view controller modally.
Support peer-to-peer connectivity and the discovery of nearby devices.
The

is a convenience class that handles advertising, presents incoming invitations to the user, and handles users’ responses. Use this class to provide a user interface for handling invitations when your app does not require programmatic control over the invitation process.
The delegate object that handles advertising-assistant-related events.
The
dictionary that was passed when this object was initialized.
Initializes an advertiser assistant object.
The service type that your app is advertising.
The session into which new peers are added after accepting an invitation.
Begins advertising the service provided by a local peer and starts the assistant.
Stops advertising the service provided by a local peer and stops the assistant.
The
class presents nearby devices to the user and enables the user to invite nearby devices to a session. To use this class in iOS or tvOS, call methods from the underlying
class (
and
for storyboards or
and
for nib-based views) to present and dismiss the view controller. In macOS, use the comparable
methods
and
instead.
The
class publishes an advertisement for a specific service that your app provides through the Multipeer Connectivity framework and notifies its delegate about invitations from nearby peers.

Searches (by service type) for services offered by nearby devices using infrastructure Wi-Fi, peer-to-peer Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth (in iOS) or Ethernet (in macOS and tvOS), and provides the ability to easily invite those devices to a Multipeer Connectivity session (
An
object represents a peer in a multipeer session.
An
object enables and manages communication among all peers in a Multipeer Connectivity session.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
